body.color: Where to get the secutiry module for Windows or Linux?
Why were the modules not included in the package (they are just 200 kB!)?
body.p: The security modules are closed-source libraries. Therefore they cannot be published on SourceForge.net where we host our binaries and sources.
body.color: Where did commands and variables description go?
body.p: A new command has been created (/describe) that allows you to check out any command or variable you wish. Try /describe ignore for an example.
You can find the reference online (the ability to browse) here: http://ezQuake.SourceForge.net/docs/
Based on FuhQuake 0.31 by A Nourai (Fuh), which was based on ZQuake by Anton Gavrilov (Tonik), which was based on QuakeWorld by id Software. FuhQuake 0.31 credits apply.
The first ezQuake version (for MS Windows) has been created by Hugo Dworak, and then ported to Linux by David Balcom.
